Description: This session will present the current work of the AACR Trust in Science Task Force. Composed of a multidisciplinary group of AACR member scientists, clinicians, and cancer advocates, the mission of the Trust in Science Task Force is to foster partners who agree to collectively develop a common agenda to improve cancer research and care by developing policies and practices that promote societal trust in science and cultivate diversity as an Ethos of the AACR and its collaborators. The session will include an opportunity for all attendees to discuss trust in science and contribute to this important emerging area.
SearchResultBody: FO04. Can Trust in Science Help Us Decrease Cancer Health Care Disparities and Increase Clinical Trials Participation?
Title: Can Trust in Science Help Us Decrease Cancer Health Care Disparities and Increase Clinical Trials Participation?
